section.p: A drug used to produce anesthesia. causing a loss of normal sensation or feeling. The loss of sensation and usually of consciousness without loss of vital functions artificially produced by the administration of one or more agents that block the passage of pain impulses along nerve pathways to the brain Source: Merriam-Webster's Medical Dictionary, 2002 Merriam-Webster, Inc.

ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] anesthetistCategory with data type Code
A Code set that identifies the category to which the Anesthesist belongs.

Contains exactly one [1..1] catheterRemovedDateTime with data type Point In Time
Date and Time the catheter was removed. from the patient.

Contains exactly one [1..1] duration with data type Time Interval
Contains the duration of the anesthesia event.

Contains exactly one [1..1] inductionCompleteDateTime with data type Point In Time
Date and Time the induction was completed.

Contains at least one [1..*] admin, where its type is Anesthesia Administrative Event
To manage the Anesthesia administered.

Contains at least one [1..*] anesthesiaAssessment, where its type is Surgery Assessment
A test or instrument, often a questionaire, used to evaluate or assess the patient's health, within the context of the anesthesia event.

Contains zero or more [0..*] anesthesiaComment, where its type is Comment Event
Contains anesthesia comments regarding the Surigcal event.

Contains at least one [1..*] anesthesiaDevice, where its type is Surgery Device
A contrivance or an invention serving a particular purpose, especially a machine used to perform one or more relatively simple tasks." (The American Heritage Stedman's Medical Dictionary)

Contains exactly one [1..1] anesthesiaVentilator , where its type is Surgery Device
A device that circulates fresh air and expels stale or foul air. Medicine. A respirator.

Contains zero or one [0..1] asaClass, where its type is Asa Class Observation
Contains the patient's physiologic status. Conforming to American Society of Anesthesiologists classification

Contains exactly one [1..1] dispositionLocation, where its type is Service Delivery Location
Transferring the Care from Anesthesist
Transferring the Care from Anesthesist
Contains zero or more [0..*] anesthesiaSubEventListEntry, where its type is Anesthesia Sub Event List Entry

Contains zero or more [0..*] skinPrepEvent, where its type is Skin Prep Event
The act of preparing the patient's anesthesia administration site by washing the site with a disinfectant agent.

Contains exactly one [1..1] levelOfSupervision with data type Code
Indicates the highest level of supervision of the anesthesiology staff supervisor. Suggested include Staff Assisting Resident.
Contains zero or one [0..1] supervisorAnesthetist, where its type is Supervisor
Contains zero or one [0..1] assistantAnesthetist, where its type is Assistant
Contains exactly one [1..1] principalAnesthesiologist, where its type is Primary Performer
